subject: Photography
title: The Megapixel Race
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Megapixel Race.

hook.text: More megapixels means better photos, right? That marketing myth drove a decade of camera purchases.

buildup.text: Early digital cameras had 1â€“2 megapixels. By the 2010s, even phones exceeded 12 megapixels.

discovery.text: Beyond a certain point, megapixels matter less than sensor size, lens quality, and image processing.

twist.text: A 50-megapixel camera with a bad lens produces worse photos than a 12-megapixel camera with a great one.

climax.text: The megapixel race taught consumers a lesson: specs on paper don't equal quality in practice.

punchline.text: More pixels doesn't mean more quality. It never did.

quiz.question: Why is the megapixel count misleading as a quality indicator?
options: Sensor size, lens quality, and processing matter more than pixel count
